Does Flavacol contain MSG?
Artificial butter flavor is typically made of diacetyl or acetoin neither of which are MSG (monosodium glutamate). ... My best determination is that FLAVACOL contains no MSG.

What are the ingredients in movie theater popcorn?
"Your movie theater butter has no butter in it," Ballis writes, "but it does have partially hydrogenated soybean oil (aka trans fats), beta carotene (a coloring, makes carrots orange), tertiary Butylhydroquinone or TBHQ (synthetic preservative that keeps the color and texture from changing as the product sits).

Do movie theaters use real butter?
Movie theaters use butter-flavored oil, which has a lower water content than butter so it makes popcorn less soggy. Real clarified butter has the same effect. To make it, melt 2 sticks butter in a glass measuring cup in the microwave.

Is movie theater butter bad for you?
The findings may surprise those who choose popcorn at the concession stand because they believe it is a relatively healthy snack. In fact, plain air-popped popcorn is low in calories and free of saturated fat. Movie theater popcorn, however, is popped in oil — often coconut oil, which is 90 percent saturated fat.

My perfect popcorn container is a clear plastic, infinitely reusable "Gourmet Storage Container" with lid, from the 99Cents Only store. It holds 96.8 fluid ounces, which is a perfect size for a nice batch of stove-popped popcorn, and which is nearly double the amount of the average microwave batch. Also, I prefer white popcorn because its husks are a lot smaller and more tender than yellow popcorn husks. Any oil with a high temperature tolerance will work for popping. I also pour homemade ghee over the freshly popped corn. "Ghee" is lightly toasted oil from natural butter, minus the protein solids. YouTube has several "how-to" videos for making your own ghee, which has many delicious uses.

I make HEALTHY popcorn, and so can youall. I use the same crank popcorn pan shown around three minutes in, but mine is magnetic stainless, because I use an induction plate to create the heat.  I put just a tiny bit of olive oil in pot, yes, just a tiny bit works fine, and lots of popcorn. Heat slowly for a while, then crank up the heat upon first crackles. Crank a lot, when done, pour out in a huge container. I use a giant pot. I pour some REAL BUTTER over it and mix in a little bit of popcorn salt. Best popcorn ever, not loaded with artificial oils, low on salt, etc. Costs pennys to make a huge pot full. Many grocery stores sell popcorn in 4 lb bags, and is cheap. I get a 50 lb bag from restaurant supply though. Be easy on the butter and salt, and you have something great that you can have every day, is all natural, and with no bad health effects.
